text:
The Dow Jones Industrial Average briefly erased a 450-point dive before turning lower again midday Thursday on jobless claims, on pace to extend a losing streak to four sessions, as the recent stock market sell-off continues. Dow Jones stock Apple fell back into buy range, while Netflix is trying to break out above a new buy point.

X

Tech leaders Apple (AAPL) and Microsoft (MSFT) fell 1.1% and 1.7%, respectively, in today's stock market. Dow Jones stock Cisco Systems (CSCO) jumped 4.5% on earnings. Mastercard (MA) rallied 0.5% after seeing a "normalization" in credit-card use in recent weeks. Netflix (NFLX) is trying to break out above a new buy point, but turned lower in morning trade.

Dow Jones Today: Jobless Claims

The Nasdaq composite fell 1.1% Thursday midday. At around 12 p.m. ET, the S&P 500 moved down 0.7%, while the Dow Jones industrials fell 0.4% after briefly turning positive. In early morning trade, the Dow 30 dove as much as 2%.

Early Thursday, the Labor Department reported another nearly 3 million filings for unemployment claims. Last week's new claims totaled 2.981 million, worse than economist expectations for 2.7 million.

Among exchange traded funds, Innovator IBD 50 (FFTY) traded down 0.5% Thursday morning. The ETF of top growth stocks is about 17% off its 52-week high. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq 100-linked Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (QQQ) fell 1%, and the SPDR S&P 500 (SPY) ETF dropped 0.7%.

Within the coronavirus stock market rally, the tech-heavy Nasdaq is once again negative for 2020 after briefly turning positive and is down 1.2% through Wednesday's close. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average are down 12.7% and 18.5%, respectively, through May 13.

IBD Live: A New Tool For Daily Stock Market Analysis

Coronavirus News: Daily New Cases Trend Lower

The coronavirus outbreak continues to spread across the U.S. According to the Worldometer data tracker, the cumulative number of confirmed U.S. cases topped 1.4 million. Despite the rising total, the daily number of new cases is trending lower amid the sharp increase in testing. On Sunday, there were about 20,000 new confirmed cases, the lowest daily figure since March 29. On Monday, there were even fewer new cases at about 18,000.

Confirmed Covid-19 cases worldwide climbed above 4.4 million, with nearly 300,000 virus-related deaths. With the daily number of new cases falling, investors in the U.S. are turning attention to the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak and how fast the country reopens for business.

On Wednesday, Los Angeles County officials extend the stay-at-home order indefinitely. The order has no end date, but may be loosened as conditions warrant.

Current Stock Market Sell-Off

According to IBD's The Big Picture, the recent stock market sell-off is quite normal after the big gains in the major indexes since March 23.

Despite another sharp sell-off Wednesday, the stock market uptrend remain intact. According to Wednesday's Big Picture, "The Nasdaq's price action is the most important to watch at this point because it's the leading index. Indeed, a look at Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), which tracks the Nasdaq 100, provides good perspective. The exchange traded fund fell 1.25% Wednesday, but it's still holding above its 21-day average, which happens to correspond to its last breakout area."

Stocks to watch in the current stock market include the top stocks on IBD Long-Term Leaders. The IBD Long-Term Leaders list focuses on companies with stable earnings growth and price performance.

Post-Coronavirus Stock Market ETF Strategy And How To Invest In The New Uptrend

Dow Jones Earnings: Cisco Stock

Dow Jones tech giant Cisco Systems jumped over 4% early Thursday after the company's mostly positive results. The computer networking giant topped earnings and sales estimates, and reported in-line guidance.

Cisco shares are about 25% off their 52-week high.

According to the IBD Stock Checkup, Cisco stock has an 82 out of a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating, placing it in the middle tier of growth stocks.

Stock Market News: Mastercard, Netflix

Mastercard turned up 0.5% early Thursday, as the stock market sell-off continued. Late Wednesday, the company said it is starting to see "normalization" in some markets, as consumer spending begins to gradually recover.

Mastercard stock remains more than 20% off its 52-week high despite a sharp recovery since March 23. Shares found resistance at their long-term 200-day line in recent sessions.

FANG stock leader Netflix is trying to break out above a 449.62 buy point, but fell back below the new entry in morning trade. Shares advanced as much as 3.2% to 452.38 before reversing lower to fall over 1%.

The new buy point is the result of a short consolidation above its prior base. The entry is considered an add-on point, a chance to add shares to an existing position.

Netflix was featured as Thursday's IBD Stock Of The Day.

The IBD Stock Checkup says that Netflix stock boasts a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating. The Composite Rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.

Dow Jones Leaders: Apple, Microsoft

Dow Jones leader Apple stock fell 1.1% Thursday, on pace to extend a losing streak to three sessions.

Shares are pulling back into the 5% buy zone of a cup-with-handle's 288.35 buy point, according to MarketSmith chart analysis. The 5% buy range goes up to 302.77. Shares are about 7% off their all-time highs, nearly completing a remarkable recovery from the coronavirus stock market crash.

The iPhone maker is an IBD Leaderboard member. According to Leaderboard commentary, "The stock broke out in soft volume but that can happen sometimes with megacaps. The relative strength line is at new highs, a plus. The base is second stage." Apple stock has a 90 out of a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating.

Meanwhile, tech giant Microsoft moved down 1.7% Thursday, set to fall for a third straight day. Shares are below their recent cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point. The buy zone runs up to 189.11. Microsoft is also an IBD Leaderboard stock idea and an IBD Long-Term Leader.

Shares also broke out on April 16 above a 175.10 correct buy point in a double bottom, according to MarketSmith chart analysis.

Be sure to follow Scott Lehtonen on Twitter at @IBD_SLehtonen for more on growth stocks and the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">

<ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/lehtonens/" title="Posts by SCOTT LEHTONEN" class="author url fn" rel="author">SCOTT LEHTONEN</a></span></li>
<li class="post-time">12:00 PM ET 05/14/2020</li>

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>The Dow Jones Industrial Average briefly erased a 450-point dive before turning lower again midday Thursday on jobless claims, on pace to extend a losing streak to four sessions, as the recent stock market sell-off continues. <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/dow-jones-stocks/">Dow Jones stock</a> Apple fell back into buy range, while Netflix is trying to break out above a new buy point.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5818433" vid-dom-id="5818433-5ec495492d796" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/zxHTXAnN.m3u8" data-captions="[{"name":"English","url":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/tracks\/uTqcmvxL"}]" vid-name="Weakness Hits But Was It Due? <span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>

</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Weakness Hits But Was It Due? <p>Tech leaders <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>) and <strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>) fell 1.1% and 1.7%, respectively, in <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-market-today-market-trends-best-stocks-buy-watch/">today's stock market.</a> Dow Jones stock <strong>Cisco Systems</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=CSCO' target='_blank'>CSCO</a>) jumped 4.5% on earnings. <strong>Mastercard</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MA' target='_blank'>MA</a>) rallied 0.5% after seeing a "normalization" in credit-card use in recent weeks. <strong>Netflix</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NFLX' target='_blank'>NFLX</a>) is trying to break out above a new buy point, but turned lower in morning trade.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Today: Jobless Claims</h2>
<p>The <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/stock-market-data-dow-jones-sp-500-nasdaq-spdr-etfs/">Nasdaq composite</a> fell 1.1% Thursday midday. At around 12 p.m. ET, the S&P 500 moved down 0.7%, while the Dow Jones industrials fell 0.4% after briefly turning positive. In early morning trade, the Dow 30 dove as much as 2%.</p>
<p>Early Thursday, the Labor Department reported another nearly 3 million filings for unemployment claims. Last week's new claims totaled 2.981 million, worse than economist expectations for 2.7 million.</p>

<div class="investors-tickers-data-table" id="investors-tickers-data-table-4752222-1589941577"></div>
<p>Among <a href="https://www.investors.com/ibd-indexes/ibd-etf-indexes-ibd-50-etf-leaders-breakout-stocks-etf-ffty-ldrs-bout/">exchange traded funds</a>, Innovator IBD 50 (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FFTY' target='_blank'>FFTY</a>) traded down 0.5% Thursday morning. The ETF of top growth stocks is about 17% off its 52-week high. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq 100-linked Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=QQQ' target='_blank'>QQQ</a>) fell 1%, and the SPDR S&P 500 (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=SPY' target='_blank'>SPY</a>) ETF dropped 0.7%.</p>
<p>Within the coronavirus stock market rally, the tech-heavy Nasdaq is once again negative for 2020 after briefly turning positive and is down 1.2% through Wednesday's close. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average are down 12.7% and 18.5%, respectively, through May 13.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong><a href="https://shop.investors.com/offer/splashresponsive.aspx?id=IBD-Live&src=A00433A&refcode=pdsoc%7Cggl%7Cibdlive%7C2019%7C11%7Cibdlive%7Cna%7C985802&intcode=invstcntnartcls|cms|ibdlive|2019|11|ibdlive|na|682843">IBD Live: A New Tool For Daily Stock Market Analysis</a></strong></p>
<hr />
<h2>Coronavirus News: Daily New Cases Trend Lower</h2>
<p>The coronavirus outbreak continues to spread across the U.S. According to the <a href="https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Worldometer data tracker</a>, the cumulative number of confirmed U.S. cases topped 1.4 million. Despite the rising total, the daily number of new cases is trending lower amid the sharp increase in testing. On Sunday, there were about 20,000 new confirmed cases, the lowest daily figure since March 29. On Monday, there were even fewer new cases at about 18,000.</p>
<p>Confirmed Covid-19 cases worldwide climbed above 4.4 million, with nearly 300,000 virus-related deaths. With the daily number of new cases falling, investors in the U.S. are turning attention to the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak and how fast the country reopens for business.</p>
<p>On Wednesday, Los Angeles County officials extend the stay-at-home order indefinitely. The order has no end date, but may be loosened as conditions warrant.</p>
<h2>Current Stock Market Sell-Off</h2>
<p>According to IBD's <a href="https://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/the-big-picture/">The Big Picture</a>, the recent stock market sell-off is quite normal after the big gains in the major indexes since March 23.</p>
<p>Despite another sharp sell-off Wednesday, the stock market uptrend remain intact. According to <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/the-big-picture/stock-market-slumps-on-economic-worries-but-nasdaq-holds-key-support-level/">Wednesday's Big Picture</a>, "The Nasdaq's price action is the most important to watch at this point because it's the leading index. Indeed, a look at Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), which tracks the Nasdaq 100, provides good perspective. The exchange traded fund fell 1.25% Wednesday, but it's still holding above its 21-day average, which happens to correspond to its last breakout area."</p>
<p>Stocks to watch in the current stock market include the top stocks on <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leaders</a>. The IBD Long-Term Leaders list focuses on companies with stable earnings growth and price performance.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/ibds-etf-market-strategy/ibds-etf-market-strategy/"><strong>Post-Coronavirus Stock Market ETF Strategy And How To Invest In The New Uptrend</strong></a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Dow Jones Earnings: Cisco Stock</h2>
<p>Dow Jones tech giant Cisco Systems jumped over 4% early Thursday after the <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/cisco-earnings-csco-stock-q12020/">company's mostly positive results.</a> The computer networking giant topped earnings and sales estimates, and reported in-line guidance.</p>
<p>Cisco shares are about 25% off their 52-week high.</p>
<p>According to the <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/">IBD Stock Checkup</a>, <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/nasdaq-cisco-systems-inc-csco.aspx">Cisco stock</a> has an 82 out of a highest-possible 99 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Rating</a>, placing it in the middle tier of growth stocks.</p>
<h2>Stock Market News: Mastercard, Netflix</h2>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=NFLX'></iframe></div></div>
<p>Mastercard turned up 0.5% early Thursday, as the stock market sell-off continued. Late Wednesday, the company said it is starting to see "normalization" in some markets, as consumer spending begins to gradually recover.</p>
<p>Mastercard stock remains more than 20% off its 52-week high despite a sharp recovery since March 23. Shares found resistance at their long-term 200-day line in recent sessions.</p>
<p>FANG stock leader Netflix is trying to break out above a 449.62 buy point, but fell back below the new entry in morning trade. Shares advanced as much as 3.2% to 452.38 before reversing lower to fall over 1%.</p>
<p>The new buy point is the result of a short consolidation above its prior base. The entry is considered an add-on point, a chance to add shares to an existing position.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-stock-of-the-day/netflix-stock-nearing-buy-point-consumers-shelter/">Netflix was featured</a> as Thursday's <a href="https://www.investors.com/category/research/ibd-stock-of-the-day/">IBD Stock Of The Day</a>.</p>
<p>The IBD Stock Checkup says that <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/nasdaq-netflix-inc-nflx.aspx">Netflix stock</a> boasts a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating. The Composite Rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Leaders: Apple, Microsoft</h2>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=AAPL'></iframe></div></div>
<p>Dow Jones leader Apple stock fell 1.1% Thursday, on pace to extend a losing streak to three sessions.</p>
<p>Shares are pulling back into the 5% buy zone of a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup-with-handle's</a> 288.35 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a>, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith chart analysis</a>. The 5% buy range goes up to 302.77. Shares are about 7% off their all-time highs, nearly completing a remarkable recovery from the coronavirus stock market crash.</p>
<p>The iPhone maker is an <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard</a> member. According to Leaderboard commentary, "The stock broke out in soft volume but that can happen sometimes with megacaps. The relative strength line is at new highs, a plus. The base is second stage." <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/nasdaq-apple-inc-aapl.aspx">Apple stock</a> has a 90 out of a highest-possible 99 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Rating</a>.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, tech giant Microsoft moved down 1.7% Thursday, set to fall for a third straight day. Shares are below their recent cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point. The buy zone runs up to 189.11. Microsoft is also an <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard</a> stock idea and an <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leader</a>.</p>
<p>Shares also broke out on April 16 above a 175.10 correct buy point in a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/what-is-double-bottom-base-biotech-stocks/">double bottom</a>, according to<a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith"> MarketSmith chart analysis</a>.</p>
